conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible top/side faces, angled perspective, and ceiling/roof removed to reveal interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable room volumes; angled view is correct. Cutaway is mostly clean, with minor softness/ambiguity at some wall edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match the 2D plan (central living/dining, kitchen/utility zone, 4 bedrooms, toilets, and deck). Some small-partition geometry and opening placements (doors/windows) appear simplified/less exact.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, living seating, dining table) and kitchen counters are represented. Bathroom fixtures/door details are simplified and not always clearly verifiable.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is generally readable with decent lighting and contrast. Minor UI/text labels appear in the render, and some elements (windows/doors) are not crisply defined.

detected_errors.description: Doors/windows are partially simplified; exact swing/orientation and some opening positions are not fully verifiable against the 2D plan.
Minor proportional/partition deviations in small service areas (toilets/utility/foyer cluster) compared to the 2D layout; main zoning remains consistent.
Text labels are present in the 3D image, reducing presentation cleanliness.
Slightly soft/low-detail rendering makes some structural edges and openings less distinct.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with simplified/somewhat ambiguous doors/windows and minor partition/proportion mismatches in smaller service zones.
